required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Safety, Efficacy and Pharmacokinetics of CT-707 in Patients With ALK-positive Non-small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Study of Safety, Efficacy and Pharmacokinetics of CT-707 in Patients With ALK-positive Non-small Cell Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a Phase I study of the ALK/FAK/Pyk2 inhibitor CT-707 in patients with ALK-positive non-small cell lung cancer.
The purpose of the study is to determine the MTD/RP2D of CT-707 and evaluate whether CT-707 is safe and has beneficial effects in ALK-positive advanced non-small cell lung cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence rate of dose limiting toxicities (DLTs) during the first cycle of treatment (Phase I)
primary_outcome.description: Maximum Tolerated Dose(s) (MTD(s)) and/or recommended phase 2 dose (RP2D(s)) of CT-707 in ALK-positive non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) patients. Cycle = 28 days

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency of adverse events/serious adverse events
primary_outcome.description: Characterization of the safety and tolerability of CT-707 as determined by changes in laboratory values and electrocardiograms

secondary_outcome.description: Preliminary measure of anti-tumor activity of CT-707

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression free survival (PFS) per RECIST v1.1 - Phase I
secondary_outcome.description: Preliminary measures of anti-tumor activity of CT-707
Preliminary measure of anti-tumor activity of CT-707

arm_group.description: ALK-positive non-small cell lung cancer resistant to Crizotinib treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patients must be diagnosed with ALK-positive advanced NSCLC. The tumor must be ALK-positive as determined by ALK rearrangement in ≥15% of cells (as measured by FISH using the Vysis break-apart ALK probe) or by using the Ventana ALK IHC test. The analysis may be performed locally.
Eastern cooperative oncology group (ECOG) performance status ≤ 2. Measurable disease as per RECIST v1.1
Availability of tumor sample:
Exclusion Criteria:
Patients with symptomatic central nervous system (CNS) metastases who are neurologically unstable or require increasing doses of steroids or local CNS-directed therapy to control their CNS disease Impaired cardiac function or any clinically significant cardiac disease Patients with abnormal laboratory values during screening and on day 1 of pre-dose Impairment of gastrointestinal (GI) function or GI disease that may significantly alter the absorption of CT-707 Patient has a history of pancreatitis or history of increased amylase or lipase that was due to pancreatic disease.
Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply.

overall_official.affiliation: Cancer Hospital of Chines Academy of Medical Sciences

facility.name: Cancer Hospital of Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences
